title: Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument: Education
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education             Education         A class from Ajo Middle School poses for a picture after visiting Quitobaquito Springs.   Education is a strong focus at Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument. You can plan a field trip, communicate with the Ranger staff, or design your own project. There is always something to do. If you are interested in setting up a field trip to the monument contact us at 520-387-6849 ext. 7302. Educational Entrance Fee Waiver: Accredited school groups that are planning to visit the park for primarily educational purposes may apply for an entrance fee waiver. The educational content of your trip must relate directly to the resources of Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument in order to qualify. To apply, download and fill out an Educational Fee Waiver Form. Form must be received at least two weeks prior to your visit. When complete, return it via email to the address on the form, fax it to (520) 387-7475, or mail it to: Fee Supervisor, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, 10 Organ Pipe Dr, Ajo, AZ 85321. Questions may be directed to: Fee Supervisor, (520) 387-6849, or e-mail us.   Â       Organ Pipe Cactus is currently recruiting for a Teacher-Ranger-Teacher for the 2016 summer season. Teacher-Ranger-Teacher is a professional developmental opportunity for K-12 teachers to spend the summer acquiring news skills in experimental learning from a program provided by a partnership between the National Park Service and the University of Colorado, Denver.  Download the announcement and application for more information.
